page.title: 10UNEMPLOYMENT - BARGOED AREA
page.content: UNEMPLOYMENT IN THE BARGOED AREA The unemployment rates in the Rhymney Valley are consistently higher than those for Wales and the county of Mid Glamorgan. In 1972 8.6% of the working population of the Bargoed area were unemployed. In 1985 the percentage is 20.3 and still increasing at the present time. The male rate of unemployment is 23.4% and the female rate 14.9%. In May 1985, 5421 people were unemployed in the Bargoed area - 3988 male, 1433 female. (In one local junior school, of those receiving school lunch 81% have free meals). A recent innovation has been the establishment, just south of Aber -bargoed, by the Rhymney Valley District Council of "Starter Work -shops" in small industrial units.
